docs.snippet: The London "Law Amendment Society" has just received a report from one of their committees on the Jury System, which recommends the retention of the rule of unanimity in criminal cases, but advises that it be dispensed with in civil suits.
docs.lead_paragraph: The London "Law Amendment Society" has just received a report from one of their committees on the Jury System, which recommends the retention of the rule of unanimity in criminal cases, but advises that it be dispensed with in civil suits.

docs.snippet: By the steamer Moses Taylor, from here on the 5th inst., you were informed of all the particulars, and correspondence thereupon, respecting the visits to the American steamers Washington and Catharine Maria by officers from the British war-vessels...

headline.main: THE ISTHMUS.; Further Correspondence Between Captains Mclntosh and Aldham--Movements of the Squadrous and of Sir William Gore Ouseley.

docs.lead_paragraph: By the steamer Moses Taylor, from here on the 5th inst., you were informed of all the particulars, and correspondence thereupon, respecting the visits to the American steamers Washington and Catharine Maria by officers from the British war-vessels Valorous and Leopard, at San Juan del Norte and the mouth of the Colorado Branch of the San Juan River.

docs.snippet: BOARD OF ALDERMEN. REORGANIZATION OF THE STREET DEPARTMENT. The Board met last evening, Alderman MCSPEDON in the Chair. Alderman BOOLE offered a resolution playing the Chamber of the Board at the disposal of the Hon. J. L. Orr, to-day, between the...
docs.lead_paragraph: BOARD OF ALDERMEN. REORGANIZATION OF THE STREET DEPARTMENT. The Board met last evening, Alderman MCSPEDON in the Chair. Alderman BOOLE offered a resolution playing the Chamber of the Board at the disposal of the Hon. J. L. Orr, to-day, between the hours of 12 and 1 o'clock, for the reception of his friends and others of the citizens.

docs.snippet: By the Chicago train, yesterday, the party of English tourists who have been on a hunting excursion to the west of us, arrived in St. Louis and took up quarters at the Planters' House. The party is' composed of Lord CAVENDISH and Messrs. SEYMOUR and...
docs.lead_paragraph: By the Chicago train, yesterday, the party of English tourists who have been on a hunting excursion to the west of us, arrived in St. Louis and took up quarters at the Planters' House. The party is' composed of Lord CAVENDISH and Messrs. SEYMOUR and ASHLEY, of England. They are accompanied to this city by Messrs. J. B. AUSTIN and J. W. FOSTER, of Chicago.

docs.snippet: The Augsburg Allgemeine Zeitung, of Dec. 6, publishes the following extract from a private letter, giving tidings of the adventurous explorers BURTON and SPIER, and intelligence--which probably needs corroboration--of the existence of white races in...

headline.main: Two African Explorers--White Races in the Interior of Africa.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Augsburg Allgemeine Zeitung, of Dec. 6, publishes the following extract from a private letter, giving tidings of the adventurous explorers BURTON and SPIER, and intelligence--which probably needs corroboration--of the existence of white races in the heart of Africa. "ZANEIBAR, May 9, 1858.

docs.snippet: The steamship Empire City arrived last night, from New-Orleans on the 20th and Havana on the 23d inst., having experienced heavy weather during the whole passage. The Hon. STEPHEN A. DOUGLAS and family came in her from Havana. The health of Havana is...
docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship Empire City arrived last night, from New-Orleans on the 20th and Havana on the 23d inst., having experienced heavy weather during the whole passage. The Hon. STEPHEN A. DOUGLAS and family came in her from Havana. The health of Havana is reported as very good. That part of President BUCHANANA's Message which relates to the purchase of Cuba had created a great

docs.snippet: ARRIVAL OF SENATOR DOUGLAS,--The Hon STEPHEN A. DOUGLAS s arrived from Havana by the Empire City last evening. The steamer did not reach the dock until after 10 o'clock P. M., and her coming not being announced, the Senator was saved the trouble and...
docs.lead_paragraph: ARRIVAL OF SENATOR DOUGLAS,--The Hon STEPHEN A. DOUGLAS s arrived from Havana by the Empire City last evening. The steamer did not reach the dock until after 10 o'clock P. M., and her coming not being announced, the Senator was saved the trouble and detention of shaking hands with his mamerous friends on landing. The voyage was a pleasant one, and Mr. DOUGLAS,
